note: Molecular docking unavailable (NVIDIA API key not configured). Molecular similarity analysis based on known approved breast cancer drugs.

TEMOZOLOMIDE.most_similar_approved_drug: Cyclophosphamide (alkylating agent class, but different scaffold)
TEMOZOLOMIDE.interpretation: Structurally NOVEL compared to approved breast cancer drugs. Small molecule, oral bioavailability, crosses BBB (irrelevant for breast cancer). Mechanistic similarity to cyclophosphamide (alkylating), but different scaffold suggests different PK/toxicity profile.
docking_targets: N/A - alkylating agents don't dock to protein targets. Mechanism: direct DNA methylation.
advantages: No protein target = no resistance via target mutation
disadvantages: Low structural similarity to approved drugs = unpredictable breast cancer PK

DASATINIB.most_similar_approved_drug: Lapatinib (HER2/EGFR TKI, used in breast cancer)
DASATINIB.interpretation: Moderate structural similarity to lapatinib (another TKI used in breast cancer). TKI scaffold is familiar in oncology. Dasatinib is BCR-ABL/SRC inhibitor; lapatinib is HER2/EGFR. Different targets but similar drug class.
advantages: Oral TKI - established drug class in breast cancer
Multi-kinase profile may hit multiple pathways
Moderate similarity to lapatinib suggests predictable PK

ETOPOSIDE.most_similar_approved_drug: Doxorubicin (also a TOP2 inhibitor, but anthracycline scaffold)
ETOPOSIDE.interpretation: Structurally different from doxorubicin (anthracycline) but shares TOP2 inhibition mechanism. Etoposide is a natural product derivative (podophyllotoxin). Large, complex molecule with poor oral bioavailability (oral formulation available but highly variable absorption).
advantages: TOP2A mechanism validated in breast cancer (anthracyclines work)
disadvantages: Inferior to anthracyclines in historical trials

similarity_screening_summary.note: Without automated similarity screening, structural analysis is qualitative. Full molecular similarity tool would compute Tanimoto coefficients against approved breast cancer drug database.
similarity_screening_summary.key_finding: All three repurposing candidates (TEMOZOLOMIDE, DASATINIB, ETOPOSIDE) have LOW to MODERATE structural similarity to approved breast cancer drugs. This suggests NOVEL mechanisms or off-target effects, which is desirable for repurposing.

docking_summary.note: Molecular docking unavailable. Would assess binding to breast cancer targets: ER, HER2, EGFR, SRC, CDK4/6, PARP1, TOP2A.

hypothetical_targets.TEMOZOLOMIDE: Not applicable - alkylating agent, no protein target

recommendations.TEMOZOLOMIDE: Structurally novel. Would benefit from in vitro ADME studies to predict breast tumor penetration.
recommendations.DASATINIB: Moderate similarity to lapatinib suggests predictable breast cancer PK. Prioritize if pursuing TKI repurposing.
recommendations.ETOPOSIDE: Natural product with poor PK. Deprioritize unless TOP2A-amplified niche indication.
